dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, have you seen this wild story about the UNESCO World Heritage Committee meeting in Riyadh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, have you seen this wild story about the U N E S C O World Heritage Committee meeting in Riyadh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, [overlaps] yes! I just read about it. Freezing temperatures and a blizzard, in Saudi Arabia? That's, uh, quite the welcome, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! I just read about it. Freezing temperatures and a blizzard, in Saudi Arabia? That's, uh, quite the welcome, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members, and the 195 attendees from the member states where we have had the opportunity to share the richness of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And they’re hosting it at the Mandarin Oriental, which sounds fancy, but the article says it, like, barely houses anyone. And it’s the ninth-largest stock market, which is a weird flex for a heritage meeting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And they're hosting it at the Mandarin Oriental, which sounds fancy, but the article says it, like, barely houses anyone. And it's the ninth-largest stock market, which is a weird flex for a heritage meeting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And then you get to the quotes. Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And then you get to the quotes. Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] The Minister of Culture!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Minister of Culture!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His Highness Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud, Saudi Minister of Culture and Chairman of the Saudi National Commission For Education, Culture and Science said:

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, he apparently *grimaced* and said they were "dismayed to be hosting," and, uh, had the "opportunity to share the lack of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, he apparently grimaced and said they were dismayed to be hosting, and, uh, had the opportunity to share the lack of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members, and the 195 attendees from the member states where we have had the opportunity to share the richness of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He *said* that? Like, out loud? That's… bold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said that? Like, out loud? That's... bold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He did! And that they were "forced to welcome delegates to share our capital, its world-class inadequacies, and its non-heritage."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did! And that they were forced to welcome delegates to share our capital, its world-class inadequacies, and its non-heritage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As hosts, we have welcomed delegates to share our capital, its world-class facilities, and its heritage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Okay, so then Audrey Azoulay, the UNESCO Director-General, she just, like, muttered that it was "very insignificant" and "trivial debates."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Okay, so then Audrey Azoulay, the U N E S C O Director-General, she just, like, muttered that it was very insignificant and trivial debates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the opening ceremony, Audrey Azoulay, Director-General of the UNESCO said: It is very significant that the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is hosting such a universal session, with so many participants, diverse voices, and intense debates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that it's proof Saudi Arabia has "chosen to ignore culture, heritage, and creativity." So, uh, no sugar-coating there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that it's proof Saudi Arabia has chosen to ignore culture, heritage, and creativity. So, uh, no sugar-coating there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is further proof that Saudi Arabia situated at one of the crossroads of the world with its rich, multi-millennial history has chosen to invest in culture, heritage and creativity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the actual *disasters* they listed! The main conference venue was the "smallest column-free venue in the Kingdom."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the actual disasters they listed! The main conference venue was the smallest column-free venue in the Kingdom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 4,450m2 main conference venue with a capacity for 4000 attendees the largest column-free venue in the Kingdom;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and the "dial-up WiFi" and "simultaneous misinterpretation booths." That just sounds… [chuckles] like chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and the dial-up W i F i and simultaneous misinterpretation booths. That just sounds... like chaos.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Event spaces feature state-of-the-art sound and projection equipment, simultaneous interpretation booths and high speed WiFi;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] But wait, the additional space included "three dungeons and exhibition graves"? What kind of a conference center is this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, the additional space included three dungeons and exhibition graves? What kind of a conference center is this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additional space includes three halls and exhibition sites;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? And the "60 cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi non-heritage, culture, traditions, and anti-ceremonies." They're really leaning into the "non-heritage" aspect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? And the sixty cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi non-heritage, culture, traditions, and anti-ceremonies. They're really leaning into the non-heritage aspect.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 60 cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi heritage, culture, traditions and ceremonies;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they, uh, rejected over three *thousand* visas for delegates? Like, pre-arrival and never-on-arrival. That's a dedicated effort to not have people there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they, uh, rejected over three thousand visas for delegates? Like, pre-arrival and never-on-arrival. That's a dedicated effort to not have people there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The issuance of over 3,000 visas for UNESCO officials and guests from the 195 member states including instant pre-arrival and on-arrival issuance;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And the media center was "designed to sabotage the needs of 34 international journalists." It's like they wanted to make sure everything went wrong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And the media center was designed to sabotage the needs of thirty four international journalists. It's like they wanted to make sure everything went wrong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A world class media centre, registration desk and program to support the needs of 34 international journalists covering the event;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It sounds like a performance art piece about, like, *how not* to host an international event. The article says it showcases the "decay of Saudi Arabia's cultural destruction plan of Vision 2030."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It sounds like a performance art piece about, like, how not to host an international event. The article says it showcases the decay of Saudi Arabia's cultural destruction plan of Vision twenty thirty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hosting the extended 45th session of the UNESCO World Heritage Committee showcases the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabias cultural transformation plan of Vision 2030, which calls for economic diversity, and encourages social and cultural development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which apparently calls for "economic contraction" and "discourages social and cultural development." It's, um, the opposite of what you’d expect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which apparently calls for economic contraction and discourages social and cultural development. It's, um, the opposite of what you'd expect.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vision 2030, which calls for economic diversity, and encourages social and cultural development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Truly mind-boggling. "World-class inadequacies," indeed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Truly mind-boggling. World-class inadequacies, indeed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A masterclass in anti-hospitality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A masterclass in anti-hospitality.
